intro: Castilleja hispida, commonly known as the hairy stalked milkvetch, is a hemiparasitic plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. The plant has a slender, hairy stem that can reach up to 60 centimeters in height. Its leaves are alternate and linear, and it produces small, yellowish to reddish flowers in clusters. Castilleja hispida relies on other plants for some of its nutrients, making it an important component of its ecosystem.
